questions.question_text: A network technician needs to set up an access method for Ann, a manager, to work from home. Ann needs to locally mapped corporate resources to perform her job. Which of the following would provide secure access to the corporate resources?

discussion.content: "Ann needs to locally mapped corporate resources to perform her job"... What?

comments.content: maybe because a VPN makes it feel like you're working locally, perhaps!
Dude I must have read that sentence like 8 times trying to understand it, lol.

discussion.content: Typically, logon scripts are no longer in use.. there are modern ways to work around this. what I do at our business is simple, I map the drives with IP's from the get go(and not "P:\ Payroll etc) that way you skip the need for internal DNS to resolve on the VPN. Ideally you would place your VPN on a separate VLAN.
Also, I would like to add that the option with SSH specifically mentions a server. She needs access to corporate resources, not just one server.

its very tpical with the VPN logon process that as you log on, the usual logon scripts run on your machine and map the network shares provided on the corporate network to local "logical" drives on your machine. So lets say you are in accounting and there is a share on the accounting server called "accounting-share", well when you logon to VPN succescully there will be a script or commmand that runs in the background to create a logical drive like "M:\" on your local machine and then point it to the network share... hope this explains it...

choices.A: Utilize an SSH connection to the corporate server.
choices.C: Allow RDP through an external firewall.
choices.B: Use TFTP to transfer files to corporate resources.

questions.question_text: A recently constructed building makes use of glass and natural light. Users in the building are reporting poor cellular connectivity and speeds. Which of the following is MOST likely the cause?

discussion.content: Shouldn't it be refraction when we are talking about glass?

yes
Refraction: Is when a signal passes through an object and exists at a different angle. The presence of glass or water (especially during weather) can cause this.

questions.question_text: A network technician is working on a new switch implementation to expand the network. Which of the following is the BEST option to ensure the implementation goes according to business requirements?

discussion.content:
Choose the right answer by exclusion here:
- AUP has no sense
- NDA has no sense
- SLA has no sense

choices.C: The object identifier is modified and reported during the next monitoring cycle.
choices.A: A trap message is sent via UDP to the monitoring workstation.
choices.B: The SET function pushes an alert to the MIB database.
choices.D: A response message is sent from the agent to the manager.

discussion.content:
"An NMS can tell an agent to make changes to the information it queries and sends through a Set PDU, specifically SetRequest"
"An agent can send a Trap with or without prior action from the SNMP manager."
-Mike Meyers, Network+, page 702-703

In this question, there isn't a change being requested (therefore it's not Set). It's a Trap message letting the technician know that a prescribed value or threshold has been exceeded. An example the book uses is a printer letting technicians automatically know when it is out of ink.
A utilization spike will cause the device to send a trap message (alert) to the SNMPv3 server's port 161 via UDP.

comments.content: As far as I can tell, because all the other answers are rubbish.

discussion.content: Can anybody explain why is A?

questions.question_text: A technician is utilizing SNMPv3 to monitor network statistics. Which of the following actions would occur immediately of a server's utilization spikes above the prescribed value?

discussion.content: Crossover cables are used when you connect two similar devices like two computers.

comments.content: no, only E. The C are different.

discussion.content: Its C and E but E is most common. Same type of devices use crossover cable
